response: narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen at a fairground near Gordon Crescent, AB34 5HJ. After playing there with Roger Cooper, Geoffrey vanished while on a ride. Authorities located him safely the next morning.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, age 6, was reported missing from his home on North Lane, Archiestown. He had been couch-surfing between homes, including a brief stay at a university near Seafield Circle, Buckie, AB56 5AD. Despite the initial high risk level, Geoffrey's absence remained unexplained, leading to collaborative efforts between authorities and volunteers. A colleague of his foster family was instrumental in examining potential hideouts. Eventually, Geoffrey was found safe by police at a residence on Gordon Crescent, AB34 5HJ, several days later.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen at a bustling fairground, having spent the day with a friend. Witnesses mentioned seeing Geoffrey becoming separated from his group on the ride. Initially, his friends thought he had headed back to a friend’s house nearby. The fairground, located in an urban area, was crowded and full of distractions. When Geoffrey failed to turn up at the friend's house or make contact, concerns arose. After several days of searching, police successfully located him safe at an address along Bog Road, bringing relief to all involved.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, a young boy living in foster care, was last seen at the bustling fairground near 14 East Park, Inchmarlo. He was accompanied by his friend, Cheryl Phillips. Witnesses reported that he wandered off from the fast food restaurant area while Cheryl was distracted playing a game. Despite the high foot traffic and vibrant atmosphere, Geoffrey could not be located after his separation from the group. The situation escalated due to his age and initial high-risk assessment. Local authorities were alerted, and extensive searches were conducted in all surrounding areas, including 10 East Cathcart Street, but to no avail. Volunteers from the community joined the search, keeping hopes alive until Geoffrey was eventually found safe by police at Beltie Road, AB31 4JT, days after his disappearance.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen at a sports club in an urban area when he wandered off with a friend. The staff later found him safe at 10 Garden Wood, Inchmarlo. He had walked there, following an enticing path, unaware of the concern his absence caused.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers vanished at a fairground near Mill Road in Insch, while attending with a friend, Cheryl Phillips. He was later found safe on Rannes Street, traced by police with no harm done.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen leaving a friend’s house on Gordon Crescent, AB34 5HJ. He reportedly intended to visit a nearby fairground located in an urban area, where he was planning to meet up with a colleague. Geoffrey's guardian expressed concern after not receiving any communication from him and contacted the authorities when he did not return home. Despite being a foster case, there was no previous history of running away, heightening the concern for his safety. Gordon Crescent was searched, but there was no sign of Geoffrey. After a comprehensive search effort, involving both community volunteers and the police, Geoffrey was located safe on Bog Road, AB31 4JU, and returned home shortly thereafter. The investigation concluded without any indications of foul play.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, an 8-year-old foster child, was last seen at a fairground near a friend's house. His friends and Geoffrey were enjoying the attractions, and Geoffrey seemed particularly fascinated by a ride located near a quieter part of the fairground. Amid the bustling crowd, his friends briefly lost sight of him. Initial assumptions were that Geoffrey may have wandered off towards Beltie Road, AB31 4JT, perhaps in pursuit of more rides. His friends alerted their parents, who contacted the local authorities. A coordinated search was initiated, extending to nearby areas including A939, Corgarff, AB36 8YL. After days of extensive search efforts by local police and community volunteers, Geoffrey was eventually traced to Carmelite Street, Banff. He appeared unhurt and was safely reunited with his guardians.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, an 8-year-old boy living in Archiestown, was reported missing from his home on North Lane. His disappearance raised significant alarm due to abduction suspicions. Geoffrey was last seen at a local sports club in the urban area where he often spent afternoons with his friend, Cheryl Phillips. A colleague of Cheryl's, Roger Cooper, reported seeing an unfamiliar vehicle parked near the club shortly before Geoffrey vanished. Despite immediate search efforts, Geoffrey remained missing for several days. Eventually, a member of the public recognized him on Bog Road, leading to his safe return, though the circumstances of his disappearance remained concerning to investigators.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen leaving his home on North Lane, Archiestown. He had been spending time at a friend's house when he decided to explore on his way home, possibly enamored with the vibrant urban surroundings. Concern arose when Geoffrey didn't return home as intended. Efforts by his foster family to locate him led them to reach out to Tom, a close family friend, but the search proved challenging. Geoffrey was eventually traced by police to Bog Road, confirming he had sought refuge there. The incident underscored the child's adventurous spirit but fortunately resulted in his safe return.

narrative=Eight-year-old Geoffrey Rogers, a foster child, was reported missing from an after-school program in an urban area near Seafield Circle, Buckie. Witnesses last saw Geoffrey leaving the premises alone, heading towards the nearby streets. Suspicion of abduction arose when a concerned teacher noted a strange vehicle idling along the curbside just moments before Geoffrey was last seen. With no clear evidence of him returning home or reaching any known locations, authorities initiated an immediate search. Efforts were focused in and around the vicinity, including Bridgend of Glenlivet, Ballindalloch, where similar incidents had been noted. Geoffrey was eventually traced to an address in Beltie Road, indicating he had been moved across several locations during his absence.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen leaving an after-school program situated near Beltie Road, AB31 4JT. Known for couch-surfing among friends, he had recently spent time at a friend's house following alleged incidents of disconnected utilities at his foster home. On the day he went missing, Geoffrey had plans to visit a fairground with a friend, Cheryl Phillips. His sudden disappearance raised suspicions of possible abduction as he had been acting unusually withdrawn. A colleague of Cheryl's reported seeing Geoffrey acting nervously near an urban area known for its bustling fairground attractions. After two days and extensive search efforts, a concerned passerby located Geoffrey at an address on Kingsford Road. He appeared unharmed but was disoriented, resulting in speculation that he might have become lost while attempting to navigate unfamiliar surroundings.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, a 9-year-old boy in foster care, was last seen at a bustling fairground near North Lane, Archiestown. Accompanied by a friend and a colleague from the community center, Geoffrey was enjoying the attractions when he wandered off towards the fast food restaurant. His friend lost sight of him amidst the crowds, leading to immediate concern. After an intensive search effort by the community and authorities, Geoffrey was eventually located by police six days later on A939, Corgarff, AB36 8YL. The circumstances of how Geoffrey reached this remote area remain unclear, but he was found safe and returned to his foster placement.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, a 10-year-old boy from North Lane, Archiestown, was last seen at a fairground near March Road, Buckie, AB56 1ER. He was visiting the site with a friend, and the event was bustling with activity. Amidst the attractions, Geoffrey became separated from his group. His friend recall seeing him speaking with a stranger before disappearing. Concerns of abduction escalated when Geoffrey didn’t return home. Known to occasionally couch-surf at acquaintances' places, his foster family was initially hopeful he'd contact them. He was eventually located by police in good condition at an address on Dee Street, Banchory, after a tense two-day search.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was reported missing from North Lane, Archiestown, after a planned visit to the fairground with friends went awry. Concerns grew when utilities were found disconnected at the friend's house on Craigour Road, Torphins, where Geoffrey had been couch-surfing. Abduction suspicion rose as Gary Lees, a known colleague of his friend's family, was seen leaving the fairground with him. The search led to his safe recovery at a relative's home in Braemar.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen leaving a friend's house on North Lane, Archiestown, AB38 7QL. Geoffrey, along with a friend, had been planning to visit the fairground at Bridgend of Glenlivet, Ballindalloch, AB37 9BX. Before leaving, a friend noticed a suspicious vehicle parked nearby, and there were concerns about abduction. narrative=Geoffrey Rogers was last seen leaving the dance studio on Beltie Road, AB31 4JT. Before disappearing, he disconnected utilities at his home. A friend reported noticing unusual behavior prior to his absence. He was eventually found safe by police at 3 Kingsford Road, Alford, AB33 8HH.

narrative=Geoffrey was last seen at a fairground near Beltie Road, AB31 4JT, after leaving a friend's house. His friend Rhys reported seeing him head towards Carmelite Street, Banff, AB45 1GF before disappearing.

narrative=Geoffrey Rogers, an 11-year-old boy, was reported missing after being last seen at a friend’s house where he had been staying temporarily due to his habit of couch-surfing with various acquaintances. Known for regularly moving between homes, Geoffrey had spent the night at his friend’s place while his foster situation was being reassessed. Concerns arose when he failed to return home, prompting a search by local authorities. Geoffrey’s friend, June, mentioned his intention to explore the nearby area, suggesting he might have gotten lost during his exploration. After a thorough search, Geoffrey was found unharmed at another friend's home, having misunderstood the agreed-upon time to return.
